boardgame.name: A Blaze in the Northern Sky (C&C)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mini-dungeon crawl. For four to six 1st-2nd level characters, written for the Castles and Crusades ® Roleplaying game by Troll Lord Games.

boardgame.name: The Bloody Engines of the Dinosaur-Men
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An OSR-compatible adventure for 3-6 characters levelled 3-5

What makes the screams echoing down from Eira Peak? After the recent avalanche that forced the people of Eirata to file their homes, many went missing. If they were killed by the falling ice, where are the bodies? Who are the veiled merchants selling exotic meats and fruit on the northern roads? And what are the strange many-horned "dragons" devouring trees and melons at terrific rates in the Salka Marsh?

When the PCs set out to answer these questions, they will discover an ancient and vile slaughterhouse full of killer machines, murderous heat, toxic fumes, frightened captives, and monsters from beyond time.

A multi-path dungeon that rewards stealth and cunning.
Contains no coin treasure, 3,180gp in special treasures, 4 potions, one magic item, and a few doses of poison and exotic weapons.
Up to 2,425 XP in combat encounter experience in the dungeon.
Tactically complex and timed encounters.

boardgame.name: Fifty Charted Worlds for Ashdown: The Hydra Sector
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The follow up sequel to Ashdown: Sol & Xoth Sectors For Goblinoid Games Starships & Spacemen 2E.

A vast wild frontier of space where the Galactic Confederation is not the dominant power, space-farers go missing on a routine basis, and interstellar intrigues threaten to undermine galactic peace. Pirates, space monsters, and celestial phenomenon call this region home...we call it the Hydra Sector.

Welcome To The Hydra Sector, a backwater untamed region of space where the Galactic Confederation's presence and influence are mere echos in a vast cold expanse of space. This Campaign resource expands the Ashdown Universe for veteran players with Characters ranked level four and higher with a new region to explore. This supplement introduces 10 new solar systems, 50 new planets, 4 new unexplored forbidden stars, 2 new weapons, a new player-character race, 3 new starbases, 7 new alien creatures, 2 space diseases, several new ships and a detailed background of the region and its inhabitants.

boardgame.name: Attack on the Aqueduct
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your trip across the frontier is nearly complete as you arrive on the outskirts of Angola. A quick trip over their bridge/aqueduct is the last leg. You and your cohort have been wondering about the feat of engineering and move quickly up the hill to view it!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, for a pair of 2nd level characters.

boardgame.name: A Dream of Trees
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"There was a woman who had a new baby. Like all the other mothers she knew, she took her baby out to the woods, and hung her crib from a tree, rocking the baby to sleep. And then she sang a song, asking the fairies of the wood to bestow gifts on her daughter.

The wise fairy queen Gloriosa appeared and gave the baby a kind nature, so she would always think the best of people. Then she called out to other fairies to give the child gifts, because she saw that the child would face many challenges before she grew up. What did you give the baby?"

A Dream of Trees is a Fairytale adventure for the Amazing Tales role-playing game. The players take the role of fairies, struggling to protect a young girl as she grows up to fulfill her destiny.

boardgame.name: Hairy Letters
boardgame.description:
Hairy Letters is the perfect first learning App for kids aged 4-6. Learn the letters of the alphabet and how to blend first words. Interact with animations and trace the letter shape onscreen with your finger.

You’ll play games to reinforce learning and build letters into simple words as the Hairy characters and memorable animations make a fun and engaging introduction to literacy.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Idioms Game
Idioms Game PRO
boardgame.description:
Description
Test and practice your knowledge of English idioms!

Instructions
Assign what definition belongs to the idiom shown on the screen!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Hierarchy: Solo Playmat
boardgame.description: A sweet 14"x24" playmat for solo play in Hierarchy.

boardgame.name: The K'thoni
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Halloween treat from Wanderer's Haven Publications!

The K'thoni are an undead race of humans from the Asunder campaign settting for 5th Edition D&D. Though they struggle to survive, their existence is uncertain as other undead hunger for the strange essence that gives them life, while the world beyond their island borders would hunt them to extinction...if their curse did not overcome the lands beyond first!

This download details the player race stats, as well as including new spells, designed by K'thoni mages, that allow them to heal their undead population. In addition, a second PDF is included explaining the break down of how racial ability scores are removed from the Asunder setting, and introducing a optional set of rules to replace them.

boardgame.name: Races of Lost Amman: Grimalkin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For decades prior to the Spellplague, the land of Amman found itself drowning in the turmoil of war. The yuan-ti, along with their slave army, poured out from their pyramid stronghold, laying waste to the civilizations that shared the land with them. Finally forced from their homelands, the feline grimalkin and their allies, the abnawaa, fled across the land bridge to the northeast.

As fate would have it, the Spellplague fell upon two worlds, and the very lands around the refugees changed. Broken isles now lay between them and the land they would come to know as Zakhara. In the distance behind them, the confused army of sobek that had been chasing them stared across open waters at their prey. But the sobek no longer had masters, for they were no longer on the world of Abeir.

So races not of Toril now spread out across the face of Faerun and its neighboring continents. The refugees of Lost Amman spent generations trying to find a new home on this planet that was so strange, yet oddly familiar.

The grimalkin are a catfolk player race option for Forgotten Realms. Along with the rules needed to create a grimalkin character, this download also gives you two pre-generated player characters, as well as two non-player characters to use in your campaign. In addition, a magic item that was created by the grimalkin, as well as a cultural recipe (that you can actually make!) of the cat people, are included for your use.

boardgame.name: Aratare
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

I present you with an option for the aratare, a ghost-like creature from the movie Spectral. While the movie is an action-filled romp through sci-fi pseudo-science, I knew immediately that I wanted to attempt a conversion for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

Now, I will be the first to admit, the aratare as presented in the movie are TERRIBLE roleplaying game monsters, especially for the more player-friendly 5th Edition rules. They are virtually indestructible (unless you know their secret), and kill with a touch. Yikes! So I took some liberties with the conversion, leaving them highly deadly and still very difficult to defeat, yet they won’t kill most characters that are of sufficient level for their Challenge Rating. At least not instantly. Low level characters and commoners? Oh yah, they’re (frozen) toast. But that isn’t really the spirit behind 5E, so I had to do some concept bending.

Now, in a game like Call of Cthulhu, I could see the aratare being more true to their original concept. Yes, you might end up with a dead party, but for the most part, the idea in CoC is that if something is too deadly for you, you RUN! Otherwise, it’s your own fault you died. I may do up a CoC version of the aratare, and update this blog in the near future if I do so.

Another design choice reflects the scene in the movie where an aratare WRECKS a tank. I mean, HULK SMASH wrecks it. To attempt to quantify this, I included a Slam attack for the aratare that can only be used against objects. Furthermore, the aratare uses the Siege Monster rules, which increases the damage it does against objects and buildings. In the movie, it does not appear as though the aratare are even able to touch a living creature without straight out killing it, so the slam does not make sense to use as an attack against a living opponent. However, it can definitely use that slam attack against non-living opponents!

boardgame.name: Mari Lwyd
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mari Lwyd is from Welsh folklore. This strange skeletal mare appears on New Year’s Eve, and attempts to gain access to people’s homes. While the myths I found does not necessarily paint her as having ill-intentions, this D&D 5E version of her has her acting as a sort of reaper of souls, something that a party of adventurers would do well to halt.

boardgame.name: Poetic License
boardgame.description:
Poetic License is a word drafting and poem crafting game where players, or “poets,” simultaneously compose creative poems, refine their poems using their poetic license, and narrate their finished pieces with dramatic or comedic flair.

After each round, poets assign “snaps,” or victory points, to their favorite poems. The poet with the most snaps after two rounds wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Skeleton, Clay Oooze
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Much like role playing games, there are still things I enjoy doing from my childhood. One example is watching He-Man and the Masters of the Universe. Yah, it is true, I still enjoy cartoons.

Lately, I’ve been watching the remake of the series from the 2000’s, and I just viewed the episode, Out of the Past. While there is plenty going on in this episode, including hinting at Teela’s origins, the monsters that Skeletor sent after Teela and the village she was staying in really grabbed my interest. Skeletons bolstered by necromancy and strange, green clay which seems to have magical properties as well!

So here is my take on these clay ooze skeletons. I hope you enjoy using them in an upcoming campaign, a little something to keep your players on their toes!

boardgame.name: Scorched Soul
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes, the best of intentions turn out for the absolute worst. Such was the case of Diana, a young girl whose case of photosensitivity was so severe, being in direct sunlight would cause her skin to blister and peel. When doctors attempted a form of radical treatment…exposing Diana to extremely bright lights…they did not only fail in curing her, but apparently killed her in the process, her body disappearing and leaving behind only the blackened outline of where she once sat.

But this was not the end of Diana…in fact, she now exists as a creature entirely different, something that cannot be seen in direct light. But in the dark, her strength and rage know no bounds…and she hungers for vengeance against the living.

If you haven’t seen Lights Out, I do recommend it! Diana is the basis for this “scorched soul” write up, which I hope you enjoy using in your own games.

boardgame.name: Kiss of War
boardgame.description:
Exhilarating FPS challenge that gets your heart beating faster! Control beauty agents under a hail of bullets to search and destroy targets! Grow and thrive in the war, create guilds and invite global players to fight against evil enemies!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Sam, Spirit of Halloween
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s Halloween weekend, and it’s time for all the spooks and specters to come out and play! One of my favorite Halloween movies is Trick’r Treat, an anthology of interconnected tales set on Halloween. The hero (or anti-hero?) of the movie is Sam, a child-like creature who appears to be dressed in a shabby costume for trick-or-treating. But, as we find out many times in the movie, nothing is quite as it seems. Check out the stats for the immortal Sam, in all his pumpkin-headed glory! Be safe, and don’t forget to light those jack-o-lanterns… Happy Halloween!

boardgame.name: Doom Blade Cyclops
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inspiration often strikes us when we are not expecting it… Like when you are cleaning off a game board shelf, and a Mage Knight figure falls off, hits you in the face, then breaks on the floor. Ok, it was the figure that struck me…but inspiration followed soon there after!

Back during the first iteration of Mage Knight, some pretty hefty, large figures came out for the game. Several dragons, a giant that had dwarves riding in armored baskets on its shoulders, some vehicles, and more. The one in question was the Doom Blade Cyclops, and is still one of my favorite pieces from that game.

So while the super glue was doing its work, I was debating what such a creature would be like in 5E D&D. What if the scythes on its arms weren’t strapped there, as they are on the figure, but were actually welded to the bone during a ritual of terrible surgeries and magicks? And strong? These things look like they’d use lesser cyclops for toothpicks. Yah, some 5E monster making had to be done. Check out the conversion from Mage Knight figure to RPG monster below!

boardgame.name: Petalhead (Stranger Things' Demogorgon)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So, an exercise that I like to do is converting monsters from movies, TV, art, books, comics, and even real life creatures into RPG stats. It gets my creative juices flowing, and it’s fun to do. With that in mind, I’ve been planning for awhile to start up this regular blog series, “The Wanderer’s Creature Feature”, where I will post these conversions for use in your game!

What a better creature to start with than the Demogorgon from Stranger Things? Of course, it’s not the actual Demogorgon from D&D…but it’s still pretty awesome and fun. Plus, the appearance and influence of D&D in the show is both nostalgic and entertaining.

To separate the concept of Demogorgon from The Monster in the show, I dubbed the stats with “Petalhead”. If you don’t know why, you need to go ACTUALLY watch the show, cheater.

boardgame.name: Excremental
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes, you’re in the middle of a game, and your group find themselves in a shitty situation…literally. As was the case last week when a D&D group I run found themselves heading down what appeared to be a sewer entrance. This naturally led to some side conversation, and what topic should arise? The Golgothan Shit Demon, also known as an excremental, from the movie Dogma. Well, of course that was too good to pass up, so below are the D&D 5e stats for this poo-flinging fiend.

In the movie, the creature is said to be a demon created by the body waste left upon a field where many people had been crucified. The 5e write up has a sidebar, which offers some other origin options as well, both as an undead creature, or even as a foul elemental.

boardgame.name: Winter's War Goblin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ok, so The Huntsman : Winter’s War wasn’t a box office success. That being said, I enjoyed the movie. I also really enjoyed the re-imagining of a classic D&D monster, the goblin. Goblins themselves have appeared in folklore for centuries, and it’s no surprise they make appearances in iconic fantasy series such as The Lord of the Rings. However, Winter’s War was the first time that a goblin showed up on screen and I was like, “Wow, that thing is going to kick their butts.”

Bigger, faster, and they have HORNS, the goblins of Winter’s War give the heroes a serious beating. And in D&D terms, they exhibit some abilities that typical goblins don’t show (and apparently have a LOT more treasure). So check out what I came up with for monster stats using the goblins of The Huntsman : Winter’s War! See you next time.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – The Ruin of Luccanor
boardgame.description:
Amid the storm-tossed coasts of the Deep Sea, long-lost cities of a bygone age lure the gold-hungry. The bravest—or most foolish!—of these sailors is the noble Admiral Luccanor, who recently returned to the port of Umbral aboard his flagship Seawing. But ’twas an ill-wind that carried the ship, now enshrouded by a plague-fog and said to be haunted. Do you dare to step aboard the corrupted vessel and face the hideous creatures of the depths that claim it for their own to learn the fate of Admiral and crew?

Age of Darkness is a fully-cooperative strategy board game of tactical combat and dungeon-crawl style adventure for one to five players. Explore the world of Drunagor through the game’s immersive 3d environment and illustrated Points of Interest—where your choices determine the route your story will take! You need a copy of the Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness core game to play with this expansion.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness

boardgame.name: Ludo
Ludo 2020
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Implementation of the board game Ludo/Paaschi

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – Lordwrath
boardgame.description:
It is said that merely to gaze upon the Undead King’s Phylacterium can instantly corrupt the most noble of heroes. But some are strong enough to seize the Darkness within and turn it into a weapon. Commander Lordrath is one such champion—but is he a force for good, or a force for Darkness?

Age of Darkness is a fully-cooperative strategy board game of tactical combat and dungeon-crawl style adventure for one to five players. Explore the world of Drunagor through the game’s immersive 3d environment and illustrated Points of Interest—where your choices determine the route your story will take! You need a copy of the Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness core game to play with this expansion.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – Handuriel
boardgame.description:
Only the rarest of individuals can walk the Path of Nature and assume the mantle of ranger. The elf Handuriel is one of them. Foregoing the comforts of his noble birth to protect the wild from the Darkness, his bow and knives are invaluable aids to any band of heroes!

Age of Darkness is a fully-cooperative strategy board game of tactical combat and dungeon-crawl style adventure for one to five players. Explore the world of Drunagor through the game’s immersive 3d environment and illustrated Points of Interest—where your choices determine the route your story will take! You need a copy of the Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness core game to play with this expansion.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – Monster Pack #1
boardgame.description:
The call of the Darkness spreads far and wide, luring horrors undreamt of out of the shadows. Within this box you will find two new monsters and a powerful mini-boss to challenge your heroes. Do you dare to face these hideous creatures of Darkness?

Age of Darkness is a fully-cooperative strategy board game of tactical combat and dungeon-crawl style adventure for one to five players. boardgame.name: The Wandering Village
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





In a world where mysterious plants are spreading all over the earth, emitting toxic spores as they grow, a group of people seeks shelter on the back of a giant, wandering creature. Becoming their leader, players build both their settlement and a symbiotic relationship with the gentle beast to survive together in this hostile, yet beautiful post-apocalyptic world that now surrounds them.Features


Build a village on the back of a giant creature
Farm various crops to feed your villagers
Send out foraging missions to gather rare resources
Survive a variety of different biomes and events
Build a relationship with a giant and influence its actions
Ecology/Biology inspired gameplay
Unique blend of 3D and hand-drawn, hand-animated 2D graphics


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Myth 2: Worlds
Myth II: Worlds
boardgame.description:
https://mythipedia.fandom.com/wiki/Myth_II:_Worlds

Myth II: Worlds is a three disc compilation package released by Take-Two Interactive in October 2, 1999. It consists of Myth II: Soulblighter, Bushido: Way of the Warrior, Jinn, The Seventh God, World War II: Titans, and a variety of plugins created by fans within the community.

boardgame.name: Honey & Hot Wax
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An anthology of erotic art games
...
If you play these games with good intentions, and with people who’ve earned your trust, then you’ll be in good hands.
...
This book contains games of imagination and pretend for mature, consenting adults, on the theme of sexuality. You can play them at home, and each game takes between 2-5 hours, depending on the game. They are all suitable for both newcomers and experienced players of live action roleplaying games.
boardgame.rpg: In the Clefts of the Rock

boardgame.name: Table for Two
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The typical Dungeons & Dragons group has one DM & four players. Most adventures from WotC and home-brew sites like this one are balanced around this figure. But I’ve always struggled to find that many people who both want to play and have time to play. In fact, my usual party is two players and one DM, but I often play with just one player. I know I’m not alone in having a small group, especially right now as we’re all stuck at home during this pandemic.

So I gathered a group of really talented authors and artists to put together this volume; a set of adventures that can be played with just one DM and one player. They all rose to the challenge, creating the awesome adventures and incredible art you’ll find in this book. I’m honoured to have been able to work with them.

I hope you enjoy our adventures.

boardgame.name: Run for the Money
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Can a simple coin really contain information crucial enough to be worth travelling to hell and back just to recover it?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

NOTE: This adventure was originally intended to be run at Queen City Conquest 2020 in Buffalo, NY. As happened to many gaming conventions this year, QCC was cancelled for 2020 due to safety concerns related to the CoViD-19 pandemic. This adventure did see play at the online version of UBCon 2020 and ties into Pipyap's Guide To All Of The Nine Hells.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Rot Weiss Essen
boardgame.description:
Trivial Pursuit Rot Weiss Essen Edition

A game board, 100 cards with questions and answers
1 die, 6 knowledge stores and 36 colored knowledge corners
600 questions and answers about Rot-Weiss Essen

boardgame.name: Potz-Tausend
boardgame.description:
Potz-Tauseng consists of a small score block and a die inside a matchbox.

Each player gets a score sheet that can hold the player name, 9 digits and the final score. In turn order everyone rolls once and writes the number in one of the fields. After 9 rounds players add their entries as three-digit numbers. Your score is the difference of your sum to 1000. You can compensate minus points by having a full diagonal of the same number.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mahabharata
boardgame.description:
The god Arjuna has instructed the architect Maya to build a palace for king Yudishthira. The object of the game is to score as many points as possible through the construction of this palace.

Each turn workers can be moved from the city to various locations where they collect resources. Resources can be traded with kings for other resources or ornaments for the palace. After a trade is done, the king involved leaves the palace. At the end of the game, any kings left in the palace award points based on its construction.

This is a cooperative game that can be played solo. It is based on chapter 20 of the Mahabharata.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Zero Quest
boardgame.description:
Zero Quest is a cooperative game in which players will work together to explore a series of dungeons and defeat the infernal entity Zolzotha, trying not to succumb to his insanity-inducing madness in the process.

There’s a catch though: players may not communicate other than by playing cards.

Players may play a card at any time in any order. Navigation is by playing numbered cards, or a spell can be cast instead. Players start with the mighty 0 card, which must be carried to the final confrontation. Use it to destroy Zolzotha and win the game, or perish in the attempt.

The principle is similar to The Mind, but cards are played with the goal of completing a game rather than just being a disembodied mechanic.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 277 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue 277
2020

boardgame.name: Iruñeak Jokoa
El Juego de Pamplona
boardgame.description:
El Juego de Pamplona is a fun family game that reproduces the day-to-day life of the city of Pamplona.
Players will have fun trying to acquire places in Pamplona.

El Juego de Pamplona game familiarizes players with the main streets and monuments of the city.
An extremely fun game that helps to enhance spatial ability and sense of orientation.

—description from the publisher (translated)

To win: acquire businesses and leave the city.

Publisher's blurb:

The October 2, 2020 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The October 9, 2020 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The October 16, 2020 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

This map can be used as a stand alone map, or it can connect into a larger map using:

User summary:

This map can be used as a stand alone map, or it can connect into a larger map using:


Friday Enhanced Map: 10-16-2020
Friday Enhanced Map: 10-23-2020

boardgame.name: Green Market Spinner Board Game
boardgame.description: With illustrations as fresh as the produce it portrays, our Green Market Spinner Game is a fun way to play with fruits, vegetables, baked goods and more. Spin to collect products and be the first to complete your farm stand.

boardgame.name: 100 Items on a Wasteland Corpse Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product is a list of useful modern items that could be found by players scavenging for supplies from the recently fallen or old corpses in the wasteland. Most of these items have some value but they might not be specifically useful for characters at that time. Others might be useful as trade in the black market.

This list is intended for any dark future setting (like Gamma World, Twilight 2000, Aftermath, After the Bomb, Rifts, etc.) where the apocalypse has happened, and bodies and scavengers are common. This list can be applied to a shambling zombie, a freshly dispatched punk, a grim biker, or some scavenger sleeping off a good meal. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of easy ways to add a new dimension to your next fallen citizen.

boardgame.name: 50 Wild West Rodeo Competitions
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Competition forms the backbone of the Rodeo, both in the past and modern day. Whether these contests pit man versus beast, rival ladies against each other, or even provide the stepping stones for kids to take on more responsibility with their family, the rodeo has the potential to have it all.

This list is for any Wild West game setting (like Boot Hill, Desperadoes, Tall Tales, Deadlands, Rifts, etc.) where cowboys, ranchers and people of the land celebrate each one another’s company and friendly competition. We recommend that small rodeos get 1d6+3 rolls on this chart, medium rodeos get 1d6+6 rolls, and major rodeos get 1d6+9 competitions. Or just pick and choose and design your own epic event.

boardgame.name: 100 Cyber City Treasures Vol 2: Cash
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cash. Eurodollars. Eurobucks. Eddies. New Yen or Nuyen. Universal credits. Money makes the world go round, so if you don’t have any then expect your world to stop. Dead.

This list is intended for any dark future setting where stealing wallets and pick pocketing is common. You can apply it to a cooling corpse, a distracted corporate, or a street samurai chilling with her girlfriend. The results in this list include a certain amount of cash (we use the generic term “cash” to refer to your game’s dominant currency), foreign funds (another currency that isn’t dominant in the area), counterfeit credits (fake cash with no monetary value created by criminals), and gambling chips (worth their stated value at any casino or gambling establishment they’re submitted to). This list works perfectly with all “100 items in a pocket” products made by D10 Dimensions.

boardgame.name: 100 Cyber City Treasures Vol 1: Organs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Organ sales are the collection of fresh and viable human tissues for resale and transplant at a clinic or body bank. This list is for any dark future game setting where body banks / tissue technology is common. Tissues in transit can last in refrigeration for 6 to 30 hours before spoiling and becoming dead meat. Freezing any tissue kills the living cells immediately, rendering it worthless. Clinic and Body Banks have the technology to preserve organs indefinitely without freezing them. They can match organs with recipients with a minimal chance of rejection (0% if they match the sex and ethnic gene pool (Africa, South Asia, Central America, etc.) or 3d6% if they don’t). Organs with a donor card can be sold to a legal clinic (no questions asked) who will pay a fee (starting at 2d6 x 100 credits with decreases/increases for rare or highly valued tissues). Without a donor card, organs can only be sold on the black market or to corporations (thanks to legal loop-holes). Sculpted organs have already undergone gene therapy to esthetically and anatomically improve them, and these organs are typically worth twice as much. For internal organs, typically larger sections are collected (e.g. a pelvis to harvest a groin).

boardgame.name: 100 Hobby Chips of Cyber City - Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hobby chips are a massive growth area among chip manufacturers because many rank and file citizens can just ignore the hard realities of life by becoming an instant expert in the pastime of their choice. From enjoyable games to useful skills to fringe professions, hobbies rarely require the kind of extreme skill that only dedicated education and training can provide. Want to be a competitive billiards player? Create exotic cakes? Or become a bartender overnight for that big corporate party? Just buy a chip and plug it in. After all, who doesn’t need a hobby?

This list is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, etc.) where chip technology is common, and inexpensive. This little product gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to nearly anyone in your campaign with just a dice roll. This list can also be used to give characters actual hobbies and skills.

boardgame.name: 200 Wild West Saloon Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list features 200 fictional wild west names for any saloon, cantina, watering hole, bughouse, shebang, or bar you care to introduce. Whether you're looking for the perfect place to get a stiff drink, win a bundle playing cards, shoot the breeze with some old and new friends, or just to set your tired and weary eyes on a fine member of the opposite sex, these establishments can provide you with everything you need. So make use of the hitching post and find the perfect place on this list for your game.

boardgame.name: 200 Wild West Town Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 200 names of fictional Wild West towns for placement anywhere in your campaign. This tool is system agnostic and can be used with Tall Tales, Desperado, Boot Hill, Rifts, Deadlands, etc. Whether you're looking for some-place to lay low while the posse passes by, or someplace to hitch your wagon or just want to know the name of the next big village or hamlet, you'll find the perfect name in this list.

boardgame.name: 100 Items in a Nomad's Pocket
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Nomads define their lives by the roads they travel and the situations they find themselves in. With working wheels, loaded weapons and the training to use them, they prepare themselves for whatever might be just around the next bend. Whether they are completely clean without cyber augmentation, or as metal as the cars they drive, their fluid lives could be the last line of defense or the harbinger of the future.

This list is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, etc.) where high technology is running rampant, and where people are on the move. This list can be applied to a dead smuggler, a sad driver who has just seen to much open road and death, or a bounty hunter on the heels of a wanted woman. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next traveler.

boardgame.name: 100 High Tech Car Upgrades
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For some people, a car isn’t just a vehicle or someplace to listen to music. It’s a partner helping you to do a job. And that’s true whether you’re a nomad crossing the sun-bleached desert, a government spy with a license to kill, or a vigilante moving through the crime infested streets at night. As an extension of your will and your power, it only makes sense that your faithful steed has the armor, weapons, sensors and gear to support you.

This list is intended for any espionage or dark future setting (like Top Secret, Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, or any street level superhero RPG) where crime and technology are running rampant. Whether you’re equipping a nomad, spy, villain or vigilante, this roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next driver.

boardgame.name: 100 High Tech Watch Upgrades
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A hidden device tucked away into a common everyday item can change the balance of power in a moment. The watch is iconic and can hide a myriad of quiet secrets if crafted with care and ingenuity. Organizations understand this, and so they work to give their operatives those special tools that can save lives or end them in seconds. Or as the Roman poet Juvenal said many centuries ago: Quis custodiet ipsos custodes?

This list is intended for any dark future setting (like Top Secret, Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, or any street level superhero RPG) where crime and technology are running rampant. Whether you’re equipping a spy, solo, villain or vigilante, this roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next agent.

boardgame.name: 100 Items in a Prohibition Agent's Pocket
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Bureau of Prohibition’s main function was to stop the selling and consumption of alcohol. Agents were tasked with taking down illegal bootlegging rings and became notorious for raiding many popular nightclubs. Many agents were often uncertified when they were hired and paid low wages which opened the door to corruption.

This list is intended for any roaring twenties setting (like Gangbusters, Call of Cthulhu, Pulp Hero, Justice Inc., etc.) where crime and prohibition are running rampant between the long shadows of the world wars. This list can be applied to an upstanding agent of change, a corrupt servant of the mob, or a cooling corpse in a dark alley somewhere. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of ways to add a new dimension to your next government agent.

boardgame.name: 100 Wasteland Relics - Vehicle Loot 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

They call it the wasteland, because in the aftermath of this apocalypse, it’s as good a name as any. And one of the most common sites are the roadside relics known as cars. Cars offer the promise of freedom if you can actually make them work, useful sites to store loot if you can’t, and a place to hide in if your enemies come calling. Yes, everyone appreciates a nice car. Just don’t forget to shoulder check...

This list is intended for any post apocalyptic setting (like Gamma World, After the Bomb, Aftermath, etc.) where vehicles hide loot and looters alike. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next creepy encounter.

boardgame.name: 100 Wasteland Relics - Vehicle Loot 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

They call it the wasteland, because in the aftermath of this apocalypse, it’s as good a name as any. And one of the most common sites are the roadside relics known as cars. Cars offer the promise of freedom if you can actually make them work, useful sites to store loot if you can’t, and a place to hide in if your enemies come calling. Yes, everyone appreciates a nice car. Just don’t forget to shoulder check...

This list is intended for any post apocalyptic setting (like Gamma World, After the Bomb, Aftermath, etc.) where vehicles hide loot and looters alike. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next creepy car encounter.

boardgame.name: Advanced Occult Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Delve into the supernatural and strange in the far-flung future of the Starfinder Roleplaying Game with Everybody Games’s Advanced Occult Guide! The successor of Everybody Games’s popular Occult Skill Guide series, the Advanced Occult Guide complies and expands upon dozens of pages of occult lore and supernatural content.

boardgame.name: Adventurers Ready - Ship and P.C.'s
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Designed for use in Cepheus Engine and other classic 2D6 science fiction game, Adventurers Ready contains a party of pre generated PCs, and a ship for them to fly into the deep dark of the void.

A brief background for each PC is provided along with a character card including stats, skills, and a portrait.

A starship named “Matty” is provided too, she’s a rather special 200 trader with its own quirks and special rules.

Also included are details of a Patron so you can start feeding the party missions, and to spice things up a bit, a Rival!

A brief background is provided for each PC as well as the Patron and Rival. A blank character sheet is included as well a notional map of the ships layout.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Icebound
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Snowy forest path takes you to a large gaping hole where a iron bound door once stood, the chamber within bearing an ancient seal. An altar sits silent, a tome containing the names those whom are buried within. You pass a shrine with a skeletal statue surrounded by partially melted candles.

Two tombs are in the corner of the chamber of the next chamber, one’s lid broken into and despoiled. Past the northern passage is an old living area with many broken small rooms that may have at one time contained beds for the keepers and a library with a demonic effigy.

To the south, lie two other chambers, a circular chamber, as well as a chamber with chains hanging from the ceiling, and two additional tombs. Deep with this complex, behind a damaged hidden door lies a secret lower crypt, containing a chest full with the treasures.

boardgame.name: Abandoned Mountain Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A forest path takes you to a large iron bound door, the chamber within leading south and west deeper into the mountain. You pass a crumbling room, the walls fallen inward. this next chamber contains a carved pillar as well as a small room to the side which sits slightly higher above a set of stairs.

Past the northern passage is an old living area with many empty small rooms that may have at one time contained beds for the keepers. To the south, lie two other chambers, a circular chamber, as well as a chamber that looks like it was carved into a cave pocket. Deep with this complex, behind a hidden door lies a secret lower crypt.

boardgame.name: Blue Dragon's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Blistering wind blows across the sandy waste, howling down into the depths of a cavernous rocky hollow. Passages fork off the main tunnel, one leading to a small shrine containing some skulls and a meat cleaver. It then curves to connect to a small cavern with leathers scattering the ground.

Another small cavern contains a stone table carved from the wall with trinkets and weapons. A small pool of water can be found under a small overhang as you travel deeper into the cave system, It’s glass like surface perfectly still.

The passage curves around and meets with a large cavern where above a rocky structure sits mountains of gold, blue crystals and other treasures.

boardgame.name: Bloodbriar Hollow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Eerie swamp and marshes give way as you find yourself at the entrance into the depths of a cavernous rocky hollow. Passages fork off the main tunnel, one leading to a small chamber which then curves to connect to a small cavern full of tangle roots and rubble.

Another small cavern contains some ferns and bushes of watered down colors. A small pool of water can be found under a small overhang as you travel deeper into the cave system, It’s glass like surface perfectly still but it’s color tinted blood red.

The passage curves around and meets with a large cavern where above a bloody pool sits a shrine where a sword made of a crystalline nature rests.

boardgame.name: Caverns of Frigid Death
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Frigid wastes give way as you find yourself at the entrance into the depths of a cavernous icy hollow. Passages fork off the main tunnel, one leading to a small chamber which then curves to connect to a small cavern full of ice and rubble.

A small pool of frozen water can be found under a small overhang as you travel deeper into the cave system, It’s glass like surface perfectly still.

The passage curves around and meets with a large cavern where above a rocky structure sits piles of blue crystals.

boardgame.name: Thod's Crystal Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The forest gives way as you find yourself at the entrance into the depths of a cavernous rocky hollow. Passages fork off the main tunnel, one leading to a small chamber with a small stream which then curves to connect to a small cavern full of rubble.

Another small cavern contains some ferns and bushes. While a small pool of water can be found under a small overhang as you travel deeper into the cave system, It’s glass like surface perfectly still.

The passage curves around and meets with a large cavern where above a pond is a rocky structure with piles of blue crystals.

boardgame.name: Ruins of the Great Vault
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The gravel path leads you to the doors of this broken manor, once inside you’re greeted by a large statue of the god of protection, one of the last remnants of this place. To your left is what used to be a dining hall, and to the right the small reading room. A kitchen and storehouse used to connect to the small hallway which leads down into a library proper and servants quarters but, no longer.

Eventually you reach the far end of the manor, where a chapel of worship was built, a sodden book and urns the only thing that remains. Deeper within the manor however, hides it’s greatest treasure, a vault sealed with powerful magic containing even more powerful artifacts that has still yet to be breached, dull but colorful orbs sitting upon pedestals.

boardgame.name: Manor of the Great Vault

On the other side of the manor, are more living quarters, a room containing strange urns and a set of swords and shield. Deeper within the manor however, hides it’s greatest treasure, a vault sealed with powerful magic containing even more powerful artifacts.

boardgame.name: Battle Over the Black Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After the dam broke, the lower forest and plains become flooded, slowly turning into swampy marshes. Many fled, abandoning homes and ancient places of worship. This grave was one such place.

Eight statues stand upon large stone pedestals watching over the grave, as well as the remaining coffins of heroes that used to line the ancient walkway.

Bronze plaques in front of the coffins tell the tales of heroes long dead. Now overgrown by small white flowers, this place has been long abandoned until recently when a battle was fought here, bodies of soldiers are scattered among the damp soil, their blood seeping into the ground and flames lick the brush.

boardgame.name: Tomb of Black Marsh
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After the dam broke, the lower forest and plains become flooded, slowly turning into swampy marshes. Many fled, abandoning homes and ancient places of worship. This grave was one such place.

Eight statues stand upon large stone pedestals watching over the grave, as well as the remaining coffins of heroes that used to line the ancient walkway.

Bronze plaques in front of the coffins tell the tales of heroes long dead. Now overgrown by small white flowers, this place has been long abandoned.

boardgame.name: Awakened Blood Gate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Eight statues stand upon large stone pedestals watching over the location. Now overgrown by small white flowers, this place has been long abandoned, until recently when the gate was activated, warping the bog-land and its inhabitants.

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Wizard's Portal Sanctuary
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The ruins on the surface lead down to the conservatory where two large statues sit to either side of the hall, this room has several holes in the ceiling and plants have reclaimed the ground.

The main chamber has began to rumble away and a small pool of water has gathered below it’s staircase. The main function of this place, seems to have involved the now broken runic circles that are pervasive.

The curved stairs lead you up to the attuning chamber. A round room where magical symbols have been carved into the stone on the ground.

boardgame.name: Chamber of Sacrifice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Crimson magic swirls within the ancient stone gate leading to the blood halls where two large stoic statues sit to either side.

The main chamber holds a small library and the main function of this place, the many ritual circles to assist in the summoning of some foreign evil. Each of this circles is covered in the dismembered bodies of those taken.

Curved stairs lead you up to the attuning chamber. A round room where magical symbols have been carved into the stone below the bloody waters.

boardgame.name: Fel Dragon's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The ruins on the surface lead down to the conservatory where two large statues sit to either side of the hall, this room has several holes in the ceiling and plants have reclaimed the ground, growing from skeletal figures.

The main chamber has began to rumble away and a small pool of water has gathered below it’s staircase. The main function of this place, seems to have involved the now broken runic circles that are pervasive.

The curved stairs lead you up to the attuning chamber. A round room where magical symbols have been carved into the stone on the ground, and the majority of the bones can be found.

boardgame.name: Chamber of the Void Prince
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Violet magic swirls within the ancient stone gate leading to the blood halls where two chasms sit either side of an old stone bridge, violet torches flickering in the dark.

The main chamber holds a small library and the main function of this place, the many ritual circles to assist in the summoning of some foreign evil.

Curved stairs lead you up to the attuning chamber. A round room where magical symbols have been carved into the stone.

boardgame.name: Ancient Rune Chamber
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The ruins on the surface lead down to the conservatory where two large statues sit to either side of the hall, this room has several holes in the ceiling and plants have reclaimed the ground.

The main chamber has began to rumble away and a small pool of water has gathered below it’s staircase. The main function of this place, seems to have involved the now broken runic circles that are pervasive.

The curved stairs lead you up to the attuning chamber. A round room where magical symbols have been carved into the stone on the ground.

boardgame.name: Building Monsters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Books filled with pregenerated monsters are a staple of tabletop roleplaying. Not just for fantasy, either. Modern horror needs its share of terrifying creatures. Science fiction needs aliens and extradimensional beings. Even superheroes get their share of strange mutations and scientific experiments gone awry. Endless volumes have been written on how to generate statistics for the system of your choice and generate new and original creatures.

Building Monsters takes a different approach. In this book, we’ll look at monsters as full-fledged characters. We’ll show you how to develop back stories, and motivations for their actions. By doing this, you’ll have more than something the player characters can kill in order to gain experience and claim treasure. You’ll have an interesting antagonist with closer ties to your worldbuilding, the events of the adventure, and the themes and topics of your campaign.

boardgame.name: Hippogryph Codex
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A hippogryph is a strange paradox, combining the elegance and grace of a giant eagle with the strength and stability of a horse. It’s a hybrid of two things that by all logic cannot go together. Somehow the unlikely remix produces something that elevates both of its antecedents. Throughout time the mythical hippogryph has been used to symbolize everything from the contradictory nature of religious belief to the unyielding power of romantic love. To me, this amazing creature represents how the whole can be more than the mere sum of its parts. It’s lofty, yet grounded. Poetic, yet practical.

The Hippogryph System is so named because it’s full of such dichotomies. At its core tabletop roleplaying itself is the melding of wargaming and storytelling. My strongest influences are both heavier legacy rules like Dungeons & Dragons, and lighter, more free-form mechanics like those found in Fate. My goal with this system has been to leverage the strengths of each style, use them to compensate for their collective limitations, and create something singular, entertaining, and useful.

Hippogryph is a d20-based, story-driven tabletop fantasy roleplaying system. It is the collision of the D20 System and Fate RPG, but like the legendary creature it is more than the sum of its parts. This isn’t off-brand D&D with Fate aspects stapled on, nor is it a collection of feats, spells, and class abilities translated into Fate terms. Hippogryph is a unique system that blends established legacy fundamentals with flexible, DIY story game ideals.

boardgame.name: Tri-Chess
boardgame.description:
Tri-Chess is played on a hexagonal board made up of 217 hexes in three colors. Each side has an additional bishop and two extra pawns, with the baseline being RNBKBQBNR. The King moves to any adjacent hex; the Queen and Bishop cannot pass between two occupied hexes; a Pawn moves one step as a Bishop (with an opening two-step being permitted) and captures with a two-step Rook move.

When a player is checkmated, their forces are immobilized; the first player to capture the king then takes over the immobilized forces. The capture can be made by either of the remaining players.

Note that despite the identical name and designer, this game is not identical to Tri-Chess.

listing.notes:
Board and pieces complete and in very good condition. Rules can be found at http://jsbeasley.co.uk/encyc/333341.pdf on page 335 Box split taped at corners
Shipping to most UK destinations £6

boardgame.name: S.Y.N.C. Discovery
boardgame.description:
S.Y.N.C. is the cooperative game where players choose the character (phantom) cards that are best linked with the available sets of associations. The trick is that the players are not allowed to communicate with each other before they make up their choice and to win the round all of the players need to pick one and only one character from the available pool. The difficulty grows with each round as the pool of the characters to choose from is increasing.

The objective of the game is to gather members of the space expedition among the phantoms of the past (historical personalities) and phantoms from the imaginary world (fictional characters). Players need to choose only one phantom card, that is best linked with the generated association key-cards. Each player makes the choice secretly, without discussion with the team. To win the round, all players must unanimously point at the same phantom. To win the game the players must win 5 rounds within maximum of 9 attempts.

S.Y.N.C. legend
S.Y.N.C. (Synchronizing Neuro-Connector) is a super-computer that allowed humanity to establish contacts with the new worlds using the power of synchronizing minds. It has become possible to teleport phantom messengers of the Earth from the past or from the mysterious dimension of fantasies to the distant corners of the Universe. The experiment requires a group of people who can use S.Y.N.C. technology to assemble an expedition of five phantoms and send them to discover new space horizons. But be careful as five unsuccessful sessions will reboot the system and you will have to start all over again. The key to the success of the mission is the unity of thoughts and feelings of the participants. Synchronize with each other and discover the power of the collective mind as you connect via S.Y.N.C.

S.Y.N.C. DISCOVERY is the 1st game in the S.Y.N.C. family and very soon there will be new modules available including traitor expansion, campaign expansion, new phantom card sets and new assoication key-cards sets. Stay tuned :)
