boardgame.name: Our Nation's Miner
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A retro-style game where you play an old arcade machine hidden away in a basement which has an asteroids-style game with an added storyline.

Developed by Curtis Holt.

boardgame.name: Event Horizon
boardgame.description:
Event Horizon is an action/RPG. It offers exciting adventures across the Galaxy. Explore it, gain strength and fight against enemies.

Developed by Pavel Zinchenko

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Panzer Dice: Eastern Front – Roll & Write Version
boardgame.description:
Panzer Dice is a solo Roll & Write mechanic game. We will take control of a T-34 and we will advance to victory.

We will take control of a powerful T-34 and cross the Russian steppes on our way to Berlin, destroying as many panzers as we can. The objective is to cross the field without being destroyed, and we will achieve it both with our leadership and the help of the infantry that accompanies us.

Lead the fight and defeat the enemy.

Solitaire game

20 to 30 minutes

You only need a few sheets to print and play

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Event Horizon - Frontier
Event Horizon - Galaxy Fleet
Event Horizon Clash of Fleets: Spacecraft VS Alien
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The second Event Horizon game. Defend your space station and upgrade the ships of your fleet.

boardgame.name: Bundesliga Quartett
Bundesliga Quartett 2020/2021
boardgame.description:
Bundesliga Quartett 2019/2020


The classic card game for football fans of all ages.
With the Bundesliga Edition of Topps, fans and football enthusiasts will now receive the latest version of popular classic game with the stars of the Bundesliga!
Many different categories, including youngstars, storms and captains!
In addition to the classic quartet, playing cards can also be played the equally popular card game Trumpf!
Matching football categories, such as goals, games and assist ensure a lot of fun and a surprise!


Contents:
36 playing cards and rules of play

boardgame.name: 18OL
boardgame.description:
18OL is an 18xx game about trains, tracks and finances in the former Grand Duchy of Oldenburg, a German country in the 19th century. The main game play is done through the corporations and companies which are creating and operating the railroad network. Players buy and sell shares, act as CEO of these entities and do everything to enrich themselves and make other players' life miserable.

18OL is designed to be a short game (even for newbies not more than four hours). It can be played with 2 to 5 players and plays best with 3 or 4.

No privates, eight corporations ("majors"), up to five local companies ("minors"), no separate stock rounds or operation rounds. 18OL is a game with full capitalization.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bite: The Vampire Card Game
boardgame.description:
Bite is a pick and pass social deduction game where players take on secret roles as Humans or Vampires. Players will pass cards to each other then secretly play them on others. It is vital for players to figure out who is on their team and who needs to be eliminated.

But be careful, a player who used to be a Human might now be a Vampire!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rogue Port - Blue Nightmare
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A turn-based RPG and sequel to Rogue Port - Red Nightmare.

boardgame.name: DAMAGE CONTROL
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Control your squad of engineers to maintain your ship and its crew.

Developed by Ross Edgar

boardgame.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Japan/Venezuela/Tasmania
boardgame.description:
A single pack of 2 large sheets. Venezuela and Tasmania will be on the fronts, and Japan on the backs of both.

Japan (3–5 players)
This map features Sea Routes and Fishing Areas, both with limited access favoring players in last or second-to-last turn order position! Only with the Fishing action can players deliver fish from these Fishing Areas, which gradually deplete over the course of the game.

Venezuela (4–5 players)
The country suffers from high inflation and corruption. Building costs increase continually while goods are extremely scarce. You can, however, issue unlimited shares to support your enterprise (if you have the income to support it)!

Tasmania (3–4 players)
60% of the island is natural parks. Building in forests costs you cash and income! There is also an additional Tax phase where players must pay a fee for each of their links.

boardgame.name: CONTASION 2
boardgame.description:
User Summary

An open-world action game where you play as a criminal. There are single player and online multi-player options.

Developed by Alex Woodcock.

boardgame.name: Bar Fight the Card Game
boardgame.description:
In Bar Fight, you represent a bar competing in the world's most prestigious bartending competition. Each bar has it's own unique bonus ability, and signature and classic cocktails that can boost your score.

Each round you'll make a drink by combining Spirit, Mixer, and Flair cards in order to impress the specific Judge for the round. Different ingredients have various effects on each other, and the Judges have their own preferences, so there are countless ways to make a great drink. Judge cards are revealed three rounds in advance, so players must both impress the current Judge but also plan ahead for future rounds.

The highest scoring drink of the round wins that round's Judge Card, worth a number of Prize Ribbons, and the first player to get enough Ribbons wins the title of Bar Fight Champion!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Luxor Evolved
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The latest (and possibly last) game in the Luxor series of match-3 games.

boardgame.name: Xboat (No. 3 - Oct 2020)
boardgame.description:
From the Welcome article

Welcome to the Far Far Future. The place is the Republic of Regina.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Library Data: The Republic of Regina
Ship's Locker: Kesler-Khalan .75 Caliber Recoilless Pistol

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 42)
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

From Tom Roake comes the latest issue of The New Marvel-Phile... this time, another Earth! We are proud to present the Shadowline Saga from Marvel's Epic line, featuring the Shadow Dwellers of Earth-88194.

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 43)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

As Halloween is here, we thought we'd present something horrifying... The Monsters of Evil!!! From Andrew Goldstein, the Monsters of Evil are a group of demonically possessed beasts that can present a special challenge to your heroes.

Download it now... if you dare!!!

boardgame.name: Endless Zone
boardgame.description:
https://segaretro.org/Endless_Zone

A small, fast-paced game inspired by SEGA’s "Fantasy Zone" series. Play through four worlds in frenetic arcade action as you help the hero, Opbot, evade aliens, enemies, and things from another dimension on their way to freedom!

boardgame.name: The Revenge of Chuchuluh
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A fantasy-genre micro adventure, apparently intended as a follow-up to Free Supplements Vol. 09: The Cult of Chuchuluh.

boardgame.name: Track Agency
boardgame.description:
Incorporates the Track Agency and tries to stop the fugitive criminals!
Agent(s), get your tracking device and listen to the crime date. Search the newspaper to find it.
Identify the three locations listed in the newspaper articles. Find them on the map and connect them using your private area.
Point the tracker at the center of the confidential area and listen to the 3 witnesses on site who saw the guilty!
Find the guilty one of the suspects and stop him by pointing the tracker!
So, will you succeed in identifying the culprit?


Can be played solo or in cooperative mode.

Content:
- A sound tracker
- A 60-page newspaper
- A map with places in A2 format
- A triangle
- A poster with suspects in A2 format
- A rule book

Requires: 2 batteries 1.5V - AAA- LR03

boardgame.name: Unity: Elite Army Builder for Renegade Scout 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Renegade Scout takes the rulebook army builder and integrates each expansion, giving you a single comprehensive Army Builder to avoid excessive page flipping.

Currently it incorporates the points values and options from:

Anti-tank weapons of Unified Space
Veteran infantry of Unified Space


You still require the relevant expansion pack for any rules and profiles. This simply integrates the expansions into the army builder.
The army builder has also been reorganized a little to make it easier to use at a glance.

As future expansions are released, the Elite army builder will be updated to factor them in.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Renegade Scout 2: Bleeding Edge Retro Gaming

boardgame.name: Tiki Taka: Il calcio è il nostro gioco
boardgame.description:
Take to the pitch and challenge your friends with this exciting quiz game about the world of football.

Will you be able to answer more than 600 questions and earn the title of TikiTaka Champion?

Players will have to answer the questions and "bet" on the presumed correct answer.
The winner is the one who completes their championship first.

The game is a table version based on the television broadcast: TikiTaka - Il calcio è il nostro gioco (Football is Our Game), a Quiz for football lovers.

boardgame.name: The Night Comes Down
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Deacon Manor used to be a friendly and welcoming place. Often hosting nobles from far and wide as well as supporting the local community of Fettercairn. However, since the return of Lady May, and the unfortunate death of her parents, things have changed. Very few people visit now and those that do never return...

The Night Comes Down is a horror-themed adventure for the 5th edition of the world’s oldest fantasy role playing game suitable for 6th level characters.

boardgame.name: Horrific Herbarium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Bards oft sing about the trials of adventurers as they face off against man and beast alike. Blooodthirsty creatures of this world and others fill their songs, but what of the spaces in between? Much of an adventurer's time is spent outdoors, travelling from one place to another, and those that dare venture off the beaten path often find themselves threatened by those overlooked enemies: plants. This tome aims to educate the prudent adventurer on some of the more sinister plants they may encounter on their travels. Though these foes may not be sentient, they still pose a risk, and thou would be a fool to disregard them.

boardgame.name: Horrific Herbarium - Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The second installment in a series of field guides designed to help adventurers navigate the deadly plants of the world, Horrific Herbarium Volume 2 outlines 12 additional plants from around the planes. Ranging in threat from trivial to life-threatening, the plants contained herein are as sinister as they are varied. For legal reasons, the author suggests that adventurers hoping to become skilled at the identification of such dangerous plants do so with extreme care, and under the supervision of a competent teacher, lest they find themselves poisoned, drowned, or host to a growing parasitic tree.

boardgame.name: Trinkets of Saltmarsh
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The port town of Saltmarsh is a nondescript backwater in the southern section of the Kingdom of Keoland. Known for fishing and maritime trade this sleepy little coastal town does it best to avoid being noticed by the nearby pirate Kingdom and greater Keoland.

boardgame.name: The Ghosts of Knapsford Hollow
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Ghosts of Knapsford Hollow is a solitaire adventure for use with the Tunnels & Trolls' roleplaying system and was written with the Deluxe rules in mind. It is designed for up to 2nd level characters with no more than 25 combat adds from the roughly human-sized or smaller kindreds. It is quite a tough solo and comparative novice characters stand little chance of surviving the challenge within.

boardgame.name: The Everchanging Sand Dunes of Calim
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Calim Desert is the result of an ancient battle between two powerful genies. It is filled with ruins and mysteries. Join a group of traders making their way along the Coast Road from Calimport to Teshburl. With utmost certainty, something or someone awaits the party.

Set in Calimshan, this is a standalone adventure was developed as part of the Summer 2020 RPG Writer Workshop.

The Everchanging Sand Dunes of Calim is an adventure optimised for 5 Players, Levels 3-5.

boardgame.name: The Price is Wight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Everyone loves an old-school TV game show! ... Even the Undead.

A small village has a problem, something has taken over the local cemetary and the noble in the area is worried. Enter our illustrious adventurers. But as they enter the crypt they notice something is slightly off and a little bit cheesy.

The PRICE is WIGHT is a one-shot adventure optimised for 5 Players, Level 5.

The village is set in a non specific location so the adventure can be inserted into any campaign or run as a one-shot.

boardgame.name: Glazed Over
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wanted! Adventurers required to help source exotic ingredient for local alchemist(s).

Your party are having a well earned break and hear of a local alchemist (or three) who require some exotic ingredients and will pay handsomely for them.

There may be the slight possibility of petrifitication.

This adventure has been translated from the journals of Emrik Allwatcher.

GLAZED OVER is an extended one-shot adventure optimised for 5 Players, Level 8.

The town and area is set in a non specific location so the adventure can be inserted into any campaign or run as a one-shot.

boardgame.name: Kobolds in the Open
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The players find themselves in Telcharn wanting to purchase a pair of boots from the famous cobbler, Hundrar Thornspur. Afterwards they find work as an escort for some merchants travelling along the notorious Trade-Route and make their way to Forest's Edge to aid the village in finding some missing travellers but discover that not all is quite right in the nearby forest...

Set in The Border Kingdoms, this is the first in a series of modules that will take your players on an adventure in search of an all powerful Elixir.

The Elixir Campaign
Each module will introduce a new scenario in the campaign, some may be dungeon crawls, others may be city adventures.

Kobolds in the Open is for new characters Levels 1-3.

Each module is designed to challenge the players through 1 or 2 levels over a session or two at the most.

boardgame.name: The Caves at Forest's Edge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Continuing on from Kobolds in the Open, the party are ready to enter the cave and investigate it's tunnels and corridors. They have been tasked with stopping the attacks on travellers and a third party wishes to have the caves explored and mapped. The further they go, the more they find. The more they find, the more they realise that this is no ordinary cave system...

Set in The Border Kingdoms, this is the second in a series of 3 modules that will take your players on an adventure in search of an mysterious Elixir.

The Elixir Campaign
Each module will introduce a new scenario in the campaign, some may be dungeon crawls, others may be city adventures.

The Caves at Forest's Edge is for characters Levels 2-4.

Each module is designed to challenge the players through 1 or 2 levels over a session or two at the most.

boardgame.name: The Vauntagar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The final module of The Elixir finds our adventurers being sent on a quest into the perilous Duskwood Forest. Getting to the forest itself is not so simple, factions and creatures clash on the plains between Telcharn and the forest. Once in the woodlands, the party have to make their way deep into the heart through heavy undergrowth, a mysterious pool their goal.

Set in The Border Kingdoms, this is the third and final adventure in a series of 3 modules that will take your players on a journey in search of an mysterious Elixir.

The Elixir Campaign
Each module will introduce a new scenario in the campaign, some may be dungeon crawls, others may be city adventures or wilderness encounters.

The Vauntagar is for characters Levels 3-5.

Each module is designed to challenge the players through 1 or 2 levels over a session or two at the most.

boardgame.name: Great Battles of Julius Caesar: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
We are proud to bring back in print two classic Great Battles of History titles in a deluxe treatment (like we did with Great Battles of Alexander and SPQR). Great Battles of Julius Caesar combines Caesar: The Civil Wars, published in 1994, and Caesar: Conquest of Gaul, published in 1996 and reprinted in 2006, into a single package along with the battles that were published as separate modules.

Great Battles of Julius Caesar will have a single rulebook brought up to the production standards of the latest GBoH titles, written so that all the land battles in the original games can be played from single rule book. The one naval battle has its own rule book.

The scenario book features 20 (!!) battles presented in a chronological order that traces the evolution of the Roman military system from early battles against various foreign foes, Caesar’s wars in Gaul followed by Caesar’s wars against his Roman rivals, and culminating with the Roman invasion of Britain a century later.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Great Battles of History (GMT Games)
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: CAESAR: The Great Battles of Julius Caesar – The Civil Wars 48-45 B.C.

listing.notes:
LS Games - Atlanta's Board Game Warehouse - is the largest retailer of board games in metro Atlanta! All games are new & still in their factory shrink-wrap.
*** *** PRE-ORDER *** ***
GREAT BATTLES OF JULIUS CAESAR DELUXE EDITION: $74.99 GMT Games [GMT 2120] Expected Arrival Date at CLS Games = Summer 2022 (probably July)
*** *** PRE-ORDER *** ***
SHIPPING Continental U.S. - $16.95 International (Including AK & HI) - TBD

boardgame.name: Deck Squad RPG
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Deck Squad RPG uses a simple resolution mechanic requiring only a pack of standard playing cards - character sheets are not needed.

boardgame.name: Caverns of Calamity: Orc's Wrath
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

CAVERNS OF CALAMITY: ORC’S WRATH

An Introductory Module for Player Characters Levels 1-3
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

A traveler from distant lands threatens the fragile peace of Dùn Loachas.

He brings his new gods and a desire to unite local humanoid tribes for war.

You are the only ones standing in this madman’s way, can you save the day?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am very happy to announce release of “CAVERNS OF CALAMITY: ORC’S WRATH”. This introductory level module is the third and final installment in a series of three interconnected adventures intended for neophyte adventurers of levels 1 to 3.

Synopsis: In this adventure your players will be employed by a gnomish inventor’s organization, the Gnomish Advanced Research Institute (or G.A.R.I. for short). The gnomes recently discovered a cache of rare botanicals from the other side of the known world being traded on the local black market. After discrete inquiries, the gnomes learned the seller of these rare botanical treasures wished to remain anonymous. Unfortunately for the seller, once these exotic botanical finds came to the attention of the ever inquisitive and highly resourceful gnomes they quickly discovered (through diligent sleuthing, liberal bribes and much snooping) the source of the fungi: a set of caverns in the far southern foothills of Dùn Loachas. An expedition team of G.A.R.I. researchers was swiftly organized and dispatched, but they never returned!

Unbeknown to the gnomes, their expeditionary team was walking into the dragon’s den! The gnomes' black market contact learned the G.A.R.I. expeditionary force had been captured by orcs led by a half-orc mystic named Mulden Frux, and the gnome captives are in grave danger!

So the gnomes have turned to professional adventurers to save the day. They gnomes need the players to investigate the caverns; recover the biological samples they need for their research; find and rescue members of their prior expedition; and bring their captor to justice.

It is up to your players to save the day! Are your players up to the challenge?
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: ZU Tiles: Hime – Protective Sleeves
boardgame.description: ZU Studios made protective sleeves for ZU Tiles: Hime when it launched. They only created 2 colors, Ivory and Purple.

boardgame.name: 100 Disturbing to Horrifying Fantasy Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a collection of 100 things that characters could encounter in a fantasy setting. They range from those that seem off or just don't seem right to those where there is clearly something wrong, due to the amount of death or blood that can be seen or inferred.

These encounters can be used to add background events to a dark campaign or one where there are definitely bad things happening, or as peculiarities that characters stumble across whilst doing something else. Some could be a potential source of adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

boardgame.name: The Collapse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Every human society eventually falters and fails.

The Collapse is a solo GM-less journaling game in which you will document the descent of one such society into complete breakdown. But is all hope lost? Perhaps the path to self-destruction can still be avoided. You will most likely fail, but success is not impossible.

Based on the phenomenal Wretched & Alone system, The Collapse lets you model and explore the fall of a wide variety of societies from internet fandoms and hobby groups, to monarchies under revolution, to modern or future crumbling dystopias.

boardgame.name: 100 Modern Storage Building Contents, Set 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The eighth release of 100 Modern Storage Building Contents is a handy little list that helps a GM quickly roll up random storage locker contents on the fly. Though initially created for modern day crime based role playing, this edition and earlier versions of 100 Modern Storage Building Contents is also perfect for handling quick scavenging results for post apocalyptic characters seeking out needed equipment and supplies. Simply roll on this chart a 5 or 6 times to help load up a designated storage locker. Combine this chart with earlier releases of 100 Modern Storage Building Contents for maximum variety potential.

boardgame.name: 100 Professionals Set 22
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different professionals that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting as well as a cyberpunk/near future dystopia that has many existing modern day occupations and elements. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: When Pigs Shall Fly
boardgame.description:
Just before the days of aviation, human flight was a rumor- a whisper in the wind. Somewhere, someone was aiming for the clouds. Hoping to take advantage of these rumors and boost its image, your city is planning a contest: build a flying machine, and find someone foolish enough to fly it.

Now, you know a publicity stunt when you hear one, but the idea has intrigued you. You may be a humble farmer, but you have assets that others may not- a working knowledge of mechanics, determination, a hard work ethic, and… animals. Lots of animals. A grin slowly spreads on your face. “When pigs shall fly, they say,” you mutter to yourself. “Well then, let’s take to the skies!”

When Pigs Shall Fly is a family weight dice-drafting game in which players prepare for the city’s flight contest by researching the importance of the various theories of flight, designing a flying craft, training a pig to pilot their craft, and improving their craft’s materials to make it as light as possible. Along the way, they must also try to generate publicity and utilize the other farm animals to help them in their quest for aviation greatness. When the big day arrives, players will have a chance to see the fruits of their labor by flying their craft in the contest, and hopefully, become locally known as the farmer with their head in the clouds!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: Curtain Call
boardgame.description: In Hunt A Killer: Curtain Call you and a group of friends play a 6 episode story solving a murder one step at a time. After 80 years a dead body has been found in an attic. After the police shipped the case to the back burner you are brought in to help. You complete each episode by solving once piece of the puzzle and build up the case.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find in the Home of a Modern Witch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different things that you might find if exploring the house of a modern day witch. Some things are expected, some are not. Many are realistic while a few have a fantastic or throwback feel. Some things are related to modern witchcraft while others are more reflective of the occupant’s personality and other casual interests. Some things are horrifying while many others are not. Feel free to add to this list as much as you want or take away what you wish. Prefect for modern magic/supernatural, horror, suspense, crime, or even superhero campaigns.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find in the Home of a Modern Witch 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different things that you might find if exploring the house of a modern day witch. Some things are expected, some are not. Many are realistic while a few have a fantastic or throwback feel. Some things are related to modern witchcraft while others are more reflective of the occupant’s personality and other casual interests. Some things are horrifying while many others are not. Feel free to add to this list as much as you want or take away what you wish. Prefect for modern magic/supernatural, horror, suspense, crime, or even superhero campaigns.

boardgame.name: 50 Hirelings 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventurers need hirelings… from traveling companions to camp defenders to folks working the fields back home. This 50 list offers a collection of such individuals who are ready for hire. Included in each entry is the following: first and last name, gender, role/occupation, active description, background description, and expected daily wages in copper or silver coins.

boardgame.name: 50 Cyber City Citizens 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This one page list contains 50 different citizens that you would find in a cyberpunk settings. Included in each entry is the following: Name (often a street alias), Gender and role, cyber enhancements, and weapon. Though everything is geared for a more realistic cyberpunk setting these individuals could also be easily used with cyberpunk/fantasy crossovers.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 29
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: Oak & Iron: 3rd Rate Ship Expansion
boardgame.description:
Oak & Iron ship expansions are designed to help players quickly and efficiently expand their fleets.
Scale : 1/600.

boardgame.name: Battle Strikers: Modern Combat RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battle Strikers allows your group to play games set in the world of 80’s military action cartoons and action figures. Battle Strikers is a rules light modern combat roleplaying game. It is a skills based systems that allows you to create characters just like the action figures that you got during Christmas when you were young.

In Battle Strikers, you play the role of a military specialist in an anti-terrorist paramilitary organization. You are the best of the best and your job is to destroy terrorist and insurgent groups all over world. You are fighting against a terrorist group named Death, who uses advanced technology to create a mind controlled army of soldiers armed with the finest weapons that money can buy.

boardgame.name: In Silence
boardgame.description: In Silence is a multiplayer horror game. One player takes on the role of the monster who has hypersensitive hearing abilities and is almost completely blind. The other players(2-6) play as survivors, trying to escape or hunting the monster.

boardgame.name: Science Fiction Codex of Lists 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This book is designed to make a gamemaster's job easier when he or she creates science fiction roleplaying game adventures and campaigns. This book includes 98 RPG lists, 304 pages of content, and thousands of entries designed for any science fiction game setting. These lists will help spark your imagination and add flavor and color to all your science fiction adventures. They will produce a random result by using the appropriate dice roll.

98 Sci-Fi RPG Lists Included:

Alien Defense Force Adventure Hooks, Alien Dominion Adventure Hooks, Android Archetype, Anti-Kaiju Adventure Hooks, Anti-Supers Adventure Hooks, Armorpunk Adventure Hooks, Artic World Adventure Hooks, Assassins, Away Team Adventure Hooks, Barren World Adventure Hooks, Battle Car Adventure Hooks, Battle Car Options, Battle Car Vehicles, Battle Car Weapons, Battle Royale Death Games, Biopunk Adventure Hooks, Black Ops Forces, Black Ops Vehicles, Boarding Team Adventure Hooks, Clone Army Adventure Hooks, Commander Archetype, Crowd Suppression Tech, Dark Psion Adventure Hooks, Dark Psion Archetype, Death World Adventure Hooks, Dinosaur Park Adventure Hooks, Diplomat Archetype, Doomsday Devices, Engineer Archetype, Environmental Tech, Exotic World Adventure Hook, Factory World Adventure Hooks, Forest World Adventure Hooks, Galactic Empire Diplomacy, Galactic Empire Espionage, Galactic Empire Governments, Galactic Empire Tech, Galactic Empire Trade, Galactic Empire Traits, Galactic Empire Victory Conditions, Grunt Archetype, Hive Mind Adventure Hooks, International Terrorist Forces, International Terrorist Vehicles, Mecha Names, Mecha Pilot Archetype, Medic Archetype, Medical Tech, Megacity Adventure Hooks, Megacity Ganger Archetype, Megacity Gangs, Mind Tech, Modern Underworld Adventure Hooks, Noble Archetype, Outlaw Archetype, Pandemic Adventure Hooks, Paranormal Defense Force Adventure Hooks, Post-Apocalyptic Archetypes, Post-Apocalyptic Careers, Post-Apocalyptic Locations, Psychodynamic Frame Classes, Psychodynamic Frame Powers, Racer Adventure Hooks, Robot Army Adventure Hooks, Scientist Archetype, Security Systems, Space Explorer Adventure Hooks, Space Explorer Archetypes, Space Fighter Adventure Hooks, Space Fighter Pilot Archetype, Space Merchant Adventure Hooks, Space Merchant Archetype, Space Miner Adventure Hooks, Space Miner Archetype, Space Outpost Adventure Hooks, Space Outpost Systems, Starship Battles Adventure Hooks, Starship Disasters, Steampunk Gear, Steampunk NPCs, Steampunk Vehicles, Street Arbiter Adventure Hooks, Street Arbiter Archetype, Super Robot Adventure Hooks, Super Robot Monsters, Super Robot Weapons, Superhero Battle Locations, Swamp World Adventure Hooks, Tank Squadron Adventure Hooks, Technomancer Archetypes, Terraforming Adventure Hooks, Time Travel Tech, Transforming Robots Adventure Hooks, Underwater War Adventure Hooks, Volcanic World Adventure Hooks, Weird War Adventure Hooks, Weird West Adventure Hooks, Zombie Apocalypse Adventure Hooks

boardgame.name: The Vault of Refuse and Waking Nightmares
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A dungeon crawl based on the hit doom metal album by Dungeon Weed.

Descend into a shrine to a secret god, converted into a foul treasury for the Dark Lord.

Hear the mysterious voice of Nechrubel Immortalis. Bargain fairly with the foul Beholder. See the dark altar to the Necromancer of Despairs. Feast on unwholesome Black Pudding. Punish the righteous with Nechrubel's deadly torture engine. Discover the Mind Palace, and speak with the timeless and deathless god whose hour now runs short.

boardgame.name: Multi
boardgame.description:
Multiply your fun with Multi, where everything is multiplied!

A beautiful combination of mathematical structure and tic tac toe tactics leading to a fantastic 2-player game experience for all ages!

Multiple boards, multiple sizes, even play with multiple Xs and Os on the same turn as you play on 10 tic tac toe boards simultaneously!

Learn about and apply the structure and symmetry of numbers, multiples, and factors through play!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Myth: World of Myth
boardgame.description:
This Kickstarter release for MYTH contains three items

1) The World of Myth Lore Book
The World of Myth is based on the highly sought-after Myth Limited Edition book. It shares the same high-quality leather binding and gilded pages, as well as much of the exceptional art and lore from the original. However, it also includes dozens of pages of brand-new content!

2) Heirloom Pack #1-3: 14 unique items, one for each Myth Hero class.

3) Monster Variant Card Pack #1-3: 6 monster variant cards

(2) and (3) were designed to work with previous Myth releases as well as with the upcoming Myth: Dawn of Heroes release.

PDF versions were released on www.drivethrurpg.com

boardgame.name: Onder de Hamer
boardgame.description:
Onder de Hamer ("Under the Hammer") is an auction game. The goal of the game is to develop a project as cheap and fast as possible. The projects are famous buildings in Rotterdam, including the Cubic Houses, the Euromast, the Kuip, Erasmus bridge, and the Erasmus University.

The projects require different types of investments, like raw materials and employees. The investments can be obtained by bidding in an auction. There are six different auction types/systems in the game.

The game has to be played with four or five players, or can be played in teams. The first player who develops his project is the winner of the game.

—description from the rulebook

boardgame.name: Sheep & Garden
羊と花畑
boardgame.description:
Sheep & Garden is a tile-placement game for 1 to 4 players that takes about 15 minutes. Each player starts the game with three objective cards, and while in the two-player game each player has their own secret cards, with 3-4 players you have one personal objective in addition to sharing an objective with each of your neighbors. Try to work well together to help each other out!

On a turn, you choose one of the three tiles on display and add it to the shared landscape everyone is creating in the center of play. Once all 37 tiles have been placed, players score points based on their objectives, and whoever has the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Bloodroots
boardgame.description:
In Bloodroots, the world is your weapon - improvise and adapt in a bloody revenge quest across the sprawling Weird West.
Betrayed and left for dead, Mr. Wolf is hell-bent on finding his killer and enacting revenge - alone, and vastly outnumbered.

Thankfully for Mr. Wolf, the world is your weapon in Bloodroots - a relentless action game that unfolds across the sprawling Weird West. You’ll choreograph spectacular, ultra-violent combos by making use of everything around you, from hatchets, to ladders, to...carrots? It’s improvise or die, as Mr. Wolf fights his way to the center of the mystery: why was he betrayed?

- A world overflowing with makeshift weapons that not only change the way you fight, but how you get around
- Improvise the most deadly combos and compete for fame on worldwide leaderboards
- Fight your way through a variety of handcrafted levels, from frozen forests to towering mountaintops
- Experience a twisted Western revenge tale with a deranged cast of characters

(from Nintendo.com website)

boardgame.name: Find Out
boardgame.description:
User Summary

An adventure game where you are trapped in a large maze and have to escape.

Developed by Vorobiov Vadym.

boardgame.name: The Shadow Government Simulator
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Become the Illuminati.Infiltrate nations and take control via bribery, intimidation and seduction. Every action you take matters on a global scale. Discover and assimilate influential people into your network, customize their abilities to fit your grand plan, and dismantle all power structures but your own.

The world is in your hands.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Family Ancestree
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book

“My name is Xavier Fallowghast, and I am a historian, genealogist and antiquarian of no small renown.

“What you may not know is that I also have certain.....skills....in seeing beyond the veil, to things hidden, shrouded, forgotten.

“You have sought me out, one would imagine, because you have questions about a past unknown to you, or at least cast in shadows, murky, indistinct, just without your reach. You want answers, but have none. You want clarity but do not have the means to bring such things in to focus by oneself.


This book will help you to work out who you are, who your immediate and extended family were and how they lived their life and passed on in to the realm of death.

It can be used as a fun exercise in genealogy for no reason other than to create a small family tree, or it can be used to garner information on a RPG character or NPC's family history.

boardgame.name: Versunkene Schätze
boardgame.description: A funny magnetic game for up to 4 children. Every child has a magnetic ship which can retrieve treasures from the bootom of the sea. But only when returning to the harbour, they know what they found.

boardgame.name: Toadstool Game
boardgame.description: This delightful and exciting game is played amidst the fairytale world of dwarves. The toadstools should be brought over to the opposite side of the board, and this looks easier than it is. While playing children learn numbers from 1-6.

boardgame.name: Die Olchis: Wer bin ich?
boardgame.description: Ask questions to the other players to find out who you are.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Creatures: Die Olchis (designed by Erhard Dietl)

boardgame.name: Hoppytop
boardgame.description: How exciting! Right close by is a flowerbed with delicious flowers that look good enough to eat. Jump right over the fence and you are a lot closer to the goal! The first one to reach the flowerbed can enjoy!

boardgame.name: Gościniec: Poprzez Czas i Przestrzeń
boardgame.description:
Players play themselves as they take a mystical journey through time and space to reach Baby Jesus in Bethlehem. They are guided by the the Archangel Rafael. During their journey they will answer test their mind and body. Will they reach the manger in time?

The game has two modes. The quick mode (30-60 minutes) consists of a series of trivia questions related to Christmas (both historical and modern day customs). Very 7 days (tries) the trivia question is replaced with a physical or mental challenge - either group or individual.

In the narrative mode, the players must visit 8 locations on their journey. The locations consist of choose-your-own-adventure style narratives and choices may lead physical or mental challenges. The choices and results of the trials will affect the passage of time and available resources.

In both modes, if the players don't run out of time or resources, they arrive in time to meet Baby Jesus in Bethlehem.

boardgame.name: Belle & Boo: Möhrchen mopsen
boardgame.description: Boo loves carots. On a field nearby, there are many of them. Boo eats some, but runs away as fast as possible so that nobody recognizes him.

boardgame.name: d6 Pro Football Dynasty
boardgame.description:
You are an aspiring pro football head coach, and have just signed a 5-year contract with a struggling franchise. They were 3-13 last season and are in re-building mode. You are tasked with improving the roster, using your influence to get the most out of your team, and bringing a championship to your new city.

d6 Pro Football Dynasty is a light, push-your-luck solitaire dice game. A full 20 season game will take about 30 minutes to play. There are many ways to play. Your goal could be winning the “Big Game” in as few seasons as possible, or maybe you want to see how many championships you can win during your tenure as the head coach. The game also includes an easy method to track points during your campaign, inviting you to try to beat your previous best.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Evertown
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




The game is still in active development, but a version of it has been made available to the public for purchase - Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




User Summary

A fantasy RTS game where you must build up your town and protect it from monsters.

boardgame.name: The Los Alamos Conspiracy
boardgame.description:
A race between powers to develop the world's first atomic bomb is feverishly taking place. Without the public's knowledge, the United States is just months from this becoming a reality.

In Los Alamos, an extensive, embedded network of spies have been biding their time, waiting for the right moment to carry out their orders to steal the top secret information. Unfortunately, they catch word that the entire network is exposed and you must act now. Can you steal all of the documents and get out of Los Alamos before getting caught?

The Los Alamos Conspiracy is a tile laying game where you are trying to match certain tile patterns to "steal" files. With each turn you will place a tile and flip a tile (representing the Military Police). If you can exhaust the entire stack of tiles with all four resources, you win! If the Military Police catch up with you or you cannot get out of town with all four files, you lose the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Die Olchis: Müffelige Tümpelhüpfer
boardgame.description: Every play gets a frog and flips it into the pond.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Creatures: Die Olchis (designed by Erhard Dietl)

boardgame.name: Willi Wackel: Der tanzende Tausendfüßler
boardgame.description: All children try to put as many balls as they can in the hands of Willi Wackel who is constantly dancing.

boardgame.name: Das Ägypten der Pharaonen
boardgame.description: The players run through a labyrinth full of obstacles to find the treasure chamber of Tutanchamun.

boardgame.name: The Great Northern Trading Company, 1670
boardgame.description:
Great Northwest Territories is an exciting, commodity driven worker placement game set in the Hudson Bay area in 1670s. The player's small trading companies will compete to build up the settlement, explore the wilderness, trade manufactured resources from Europe amongst themselves and the indigenous tribes in the region, to gain furs and other locally produced commodities, such as maple syrup and artwork. There is a market where the price of goods rises and falls according to supply and demand. Players will have to fulfil contracts with the ships at port and the indigenous tribes. Doing so to gains a player victory points, as do building new key buildings in the community. The player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Das römische Reich
boardgame.description: The players train hard to become better and better and finally fight in the collosseum.

boardgame.name: Fopp' den Frosch
boardgame.description: Chaos at the frog pond! One child plays the frog with a huge frog eye mask. The other children hide the flies.

boardgame.name: A Touch of Evil: Hero Upgrades Game Supplement
boardgame.description:
As the Heroes close in on the Villain that has been terrorizing Shadowbrook, they will need to keep their wits about them and use every strength they can muster to overcome the evil that stalks them. There can be no turning back now, and no holding back in their fight for survival!

This 24 card Game Supplement for A Touch of Evil adds a new dimension to the game and an entirely new mechanic in the form of Hero Upgrade cards. Now Heroes can use the Investigation and Event cards they've found on their hunt for the creature to 'Level Up', unlocking stat bonuses and a new Ability. Each of the 24 cards in this set is unique and applies to a specific Hero, covering all of the Heroes released to date from the base game, Something Wicked, The Coast, Hero Pack 1 and Hero Pack 2.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Touch of Evil: 10 Year Anniversary Edition
A Touch of Evil: Hero Pack 1
A Touch of Evil: Hero Pack 2
A Touch of Evil: Something Wicked Expansion
A Touch of Evil: The Coast
A Touch of Evil: The Supernatural Game

boardgame.name: The Forge of Fury
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

What Waits in the Ruined Dwarf Stronghold?

Two hundred years ago, the great dwarf smith Durgeddin the Black built Khundrukar, a hidden stronghold for his war of vengeance against all orckind. For years Durgeddin labored, until the orcs discovered Khundrukar and stormed the citadel, slaying all within. Legends say that Durgeddin's masterful blades and glittering treasure were never found.

The Forge of Fury is a stand-alone adventure for the new DUNGEONS & DRAGONS game. It details Khundrukar's five extensive levels of fierce tribes, dangerous obstacles, diabolical traps, and monstrous creatures.

boardgame.name: The Toasters Idle Game Simulation
boardgame.description:
User Summary

An idle/clicking browser game themed on 'The Toasters' guild from the MMO game Realm of the Mad God. The game simulates recruiting members of the guild, farming fame, levelling-up, and defeating a progression of enemies, with a healthy dose of references and inside jokes about RotMG and the guild.

The player gains fame (the first currency type) by fighting Oryx: manually by mouse clicks upon him, and automatically via recruited guild members, upgrades escalate the fame gain. The second currency is souls, obtained by defeating enemies (for a fame cost), and the third type is gold, which increases via a special building, and gives a passive boost. There are 623 upgrades and 165 achievements to unlock; these endure while other progress is required to be periodically reset to zero for the player to access higher content and faster farming methods. There is no technical end to the game, as it can be played indefinitely.

The game was made by Master Sparky from 'The Toasters', released as version 1.0.0 on Jan 31st, 2015, and received updates and fixes through to version 1.5.2 released Apr 8th, 2015. The game runs via the Idle Game Maker online tool by Orteil (the creator of Cookie Clicker).

boardgame.name: Xanadu (OSE)
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A new adventure for Old-School Essentials, for character levels 2–3.

Welcome to the cult temple of Xanadu, an atmospheric temple-crawl for use with OSE, or similar old-schools RPGs.

A cult in the temple of Xanadu has opened a portal to another dimension. It was activated by adjusting the hands of three pendulum clocks in a particular sequence. Once the veil of reality was ruptured between this world and another, The Tooth Fairy stepped through, a winged creature from a dimension made of sweet stuff. The Tooth Fairy slaughtered everyone in the temple for their teeth, which she extracted and ate like candy. Rumors are circulating about unusual happening involving the temple, many are concerned. The Tooth Fairy is currently in her dimension, her appetite is ravenous, waiting to be summoned again. Rewards and riches may await those who venture forth to explore the temple, or dare to perform the ritual!

Explore for treasure and magic items.
Solve how to complete a ritual that summons The Tooth Fairy.
Encounter and defeat some horrible foes.
Discover unusual books and maps, useful as hooks for further adventures.
Suitable for character levels 2-3.
Includes:

All locations described in convenient 1 or 2-page spreads.
New monsters.
New magic items.
Numerous random tables.
Very easy to run!
Also, check out issue #1 of our OSR zine Aquilus.

boardgame.name: The Airplane Game
boardgame.description: This is simple game from the 1960s with the goal of racing around the race course. Players must spin the game's spinner and advance their plane based on the number of spaces scored. If they land on a space already occupied by another player's plane, this causes an "air interference" and the player must land his plane for repairs (i.e. they would get sent back to the starting space, but does not lose any already completed laps). First one to complete 5 laps around the course is the winner! Plus, the game board, spinner, and box have that great 1960's art style.

boardgame.name: The Sunless Citadel
boardgame.description:
An adventure from the collection in Tales from the Yawning Portal offered separately in selected media.

Publisher Blurb:

The Sunless Citadel, written by Bruce R. Cordell, was the first published adventure for the third edition of the D&D game. It is designed for a party of four or five 1st level player characters.

Ever since its publication in 2000, The Sunless Citadel has been widely regarded as an excellent way to introduce new players to the game. It’s also a great starting experience for someone looking to be a Dungeon Master for the first time.

boardgame.name: Dead in Thay
boardgame.description:
An adventure from the collection in Tales from the Yawning Portal offered separately in selected media.

Publisher Blurb:

Dead in Thay, written by Scott Fitzgerald Gray, was created when the fifth edition D&D game was in the testing stages. In its original form, it was used as the story of the D&D Encounters season in the spring of 2014. Featuring an immense and lethal dungeon known as the Doomvault, the adventure serves as a tribute to Tomb of Horrors, Ruins of Undermountain, and other “killer dungeons” throughout the history of the game.

The version of Dead in Thay presented here is modified for use in home campaigns. It is designed for characters of 9th to 11th level.

boardgame.name: Against the Giants
boardgame.description:
An adventure from the collection in Tales from the Yawning Portal offered separately in selected media.

Publisher Blurb:

The three linked adventures that make up Against the Giants were created and originally released in 1978, during the time when Gary Gygax was still writing the Player’s Handbook for the original AD&D game. Despite being (in a sense) older than the game itself, these adventures continue to hold a special place in the hearts and memories of D&D players of all ages.

The compilation of Steading of the Hill Giant Chief, Glacial Rift of the Frost Giant Jarl, and Hall of the Fire Giant King was published in 1981 as Against the Giants. The version presented here is designed to be undertaken by characters of 11th level.

boardgame.name: White Plume Mountain
boardgame.description:
An adventure from the collection in Tales from the Yawning Portal offered separately in selected media.

Publisher Blurb:

The three linked adventures that make up Against the Giants Lawrence Schick, the author of White Plume Mountain, related in the 2013 compilation Dungeons of Dread that he wrote the adventure as a way of persuading Gary Gygax to hire him as a game designer. Not only did he
get the job, but White Plume became an instant favorite when it was first published in 1979.

The version of the adventure in this book is tailored to a group of characters of 8th level.

boardgame.name: Hidden Shrine of Tamoachan
boardgame.description:
An adventure from the collection in Tales from the Yawning Portal offered separately in selected media.

Publisher Blurb:

The Hidden Shrine of Tamoachan, written by Harold Johnson and Jeff R. Leason, made its debut under the title Lost Tamoachan at the Origins game convention in 1979, where it was used in the official D&D competition. The first published version of the adventure was produced in 1980.

The updated version of the adventure presented herein is designed for a group of four or five 5th-level player characters.

boardgame.name: Tomb of Horrors
boardgame.description:
An adventure from the collection in Tales from the Yawning Portal offered separately in selected media.

Publisher Blurb:

Before there was much of anything else in the world of the D&D game, there was the Tomb of Horrors.

The first version of the adventure was crafted for Gary Gygax’s personal campaign in the early 1970s and went on to be featured as the official Dungeons & Dragons event at the original Origins gaming convention in 1975. The first publication of Tomb of Horrors, as a part of the
Advanced D&D game, came in 1978.

As a proving ground for characters and players alike, fabricated by the devious mind of the game’s cocreator, Tomb of Horrors has no equal in the annals of D&D’s greatest adventures. Only high-level characters stand
a chance of coming back alive, but every player who braves the Tomb will have the experience of a lifetime.

boardgame.name: Sevilla Futbol Club
boardgame.description:
A Trivia game about the centenary of the Spanish football team Sevilla FC.
Contains a die, pawns, a board and cards with about 1000 questions and answers in 5 categories.

boardgame.name: Arcane Prosthetics
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An arcane prosthetic is a magic item designed to replace a limb. In most cases, these prosthetics are designed for adventurers who have lost limbs but still feel the pull of the questing life––though some just want to recover the dexterity and ease of their fully-abled lives. Others were born without limbs, and these items are akin to weapons or magic––not replacements but tools to interact with the world. Still a fourth (albeit rare) party of people sever their limbs in order to permanently replace them with magical prosthetics, believing that they are improvements on the natural form.

boardgame.name: The Gate of Divinity
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You’ve been quite busy here, deciding allegiances and collecting plunder of great value. Weapons once thought lost to time, and wondrous technology that outstrips anything the Imperium or Chaos has to offer. The alliance of ancient Astartes, and vessels capable of deciding the fate of planets. All of these and more have been brought under your banner, all for a singular purpose.

That is, your Ascension.

boardgame.name: Freddy vs Jason vs Ash
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A town, haunted by a murderer that kills his victims in their
dreams.

A lake, where a young child drowned and a murder was born.

A cabin, where the restless, evil dead rise to corrupt and
destroy the living, and the man chosen to stop them.

boardgame.name: The Shadow: Blood & Judgment
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Thirty five years ago, a single man waged a war on crime. He gunned down mob bosses, petty thieves, insane cultists, assassins, and made his name synonymous with the fear of getting caught that criminals feel. He was The Shadow, and for the last 35 years, not a single peep has been heard from him. The scum have grown bold in that time, and in more recent years a number of deaths have occurred. With all the allies of The Shadow having grown old, someone has begun to hunt them down in a brutally sadistic manner.

The reason, unknown. The means, ever changing. The pattern, unnoticed. Until now. The year is 1987, and after thirty years of silence, The Shadow is returning to do battle with a criminal mastermind from his past who is hunting down his allies to force him to show himself.

boardgame.name: つきツキ！2 Tsuki Tsuki!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A few years ago, Shinobu Nanjou found a black magic book and used it to summon a devil – with the intention of help his sister that had a car accident. That devil, Luna, granted his wish without taking his soul and Shinobu made a promise with her. Ever since, he trained to become someone that could protect those dear to him.

boardgame.name: Naruto -ナルト-
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I'm happy to inform you that our jutsu was successful. You've been transported to this world intact and healthier than ever. Who are we? oh, don't worry about that, friend.

User summary:

The seventeen pages in this PDF all have different sizes - though all are very large.

boardgame.name: Le Jeu du Sud Manche
boardgame.description:
Le Jeu du Sud Manche

is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 550 written and visual questions including "junior" questions dealing with subjects as varied as History or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the southern Manche region, country of the Bay of Mont-Saint-Michel, including the towns of Avranches, Granville, Mortain, Pontorson, Villedieu-les-Poêles, Saint-Hilaire-du-Harcouët.

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #23 - Nov 2020)
boardgame.description:
Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #23:


Bexim's Bazaar Pages


Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

Plovin's Rare Documents - each month, a new eldritchd document prop to print for players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property


The Skirmish Table Pages


Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands

Relicblade Scenario - Spectral Guard

Frostgrave Scenario - Cemetery Scavenge


GM Resources Pages


DM Scotty's Wandering Monster - A stat block and image for 5e creature

A Swift Survey - A 5e mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift

Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game


The Crafting Table Pages


Greyskull Keep Pt 2- Craft Tutorial

Winterhawk Church Papercraft - Papercraft project from Fat Dragon Games

Incorrigible IMPS - monthy comic strip

boardgame.name: Azukail Games November 2020 Newsletter
boardgame.description:
This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in November 2020.

These are:


10 Ammunition Spells (5E)
100 Encounters for Fantasy Plains
100 Encounters for Fantasy Plains (PFRPG)
100 Encounters for Fantasy Plains (Zweihander)
100 Pulp Era Rumours to Hear
100 Rumours for Saga of the Goblin Horde
100 Sci-Fi Mercenary Companies
100 Things Dubious Politicians Didn't Want Overheard
Colour Filler Art - Mixed Coin Piles
Book Cover 10
d66 Stronghold Flaws
The Flaming Portal
Zweihander Bundle

boardgame.name: Shine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Be a journalist, a beat cop, a bootlegger, a card shark. Even a labor organizer! Charge head first into the challenges of Prohibition and come out on top or get knocked down.

This module does not model the inarguably offensive aspects of Prohibition-era America. That subject matter can be explored, or not, according to your table's interest and comfort. The value of such exploration is disputable.

boardgame.name: Hitodama
boardgame.description:
You and your fellow spirits should keep the commandments of the seasons. You should work as a team and reforest the forests with sacred seeds and bring in abundance.

Hitodama is a fantasy-themed strategy game with a watercolor style. It tells the story of guardians of the forest and their actions to take care of it. In each game, the board is changing, favoring, or disfavoring the cardinal points activating effects of the activated areas. The resources distributed on the board are obtained by the system of worker placement. During your turn, choose between playing cards you have in your hand or interacting with other players. Get your own resources to get your victory points, but you must not forget that the players must work as a team to advance through the seasons.

Hitodama is ideal for players looking for a challenge, but it also works great for novice players. The story is beautifully told with art that makes it unique.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Unforgiven: The Lincoln Assassination Trial – Neoprene Mat
boardgame.description: Neoprene version of the board with durable stitched edging.

listing.notes:
Still in shrink
Free FedEx shipping in Cont. US
Other buyers pay actual shipping.
